dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3014 IH: To amend title 38, United States Code, to expand the authority of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to make grants to entities that furnish services to homeless veterans.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Ramirez (for herself and Mr. Kennedy of New York) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to expand the authority of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to make grants to entities that furnish services to homeless veterans.

section.header: Authority to make grants to entities that assist homeless veterans: expansion; criteria

subsection.text: Section 2011 of title 38, United States Code is amended, in subsection (a), by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:

paragraph.text: Assistance in obtaining any benefit under laws administered by the Secretary for which the veteran may be eligible.
Assistance in obtaining and coordinating other benefitsâ€”

subparagraph.text: under Federal, State, or local law; or
from a private nonprofit organization or consumer cooperative, as such terms are defined in section 2044 of this title.

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (b)(1)(A), by inserting (including conversion of units to permanent housing) after alteration of existing facilities.
